title: Siege of Rome: King Vitiges attempts to assault the northern and eastern city walls, but is repulsed at the Praenestine Gate, known as the Vivarium, by the defenders under the Byzantine generals Bessas and Peranius.
text: Siege of Rome: King Vitiges attempts to assault the northern and eastern city walls, but is repulsed at the Praenestine Gate, known as the Vivarium, by the defenders under the Byzantine generals Bessas and Peranius.

title: Emperor Heraclius returns the True Cross, one of the holiest Christian relics, to Jerusalem.
text: Emperor Heraclius returns the True Cross, one of the holiest Christian relics, to Jerusalem.

title: Battle of Vincy between Charles Martel and Ragenfrid.
text: Battle of Vincy between Charles Martel and Ragenfrid.

title: Annulment of the marriage of King Louis VII of France and Queen Eleanor of Aquitaine.
text: Annulment of the marriage of King Louis VII of France and Queen Eleanor of Aquitaine.

title: Emperor Antoku accedes to the throne of Japan.
text: Emperor Antoku accedes to the throne of Japan.

title: In Oxford, Archbishop of Canterbury Thomas Cranmer is burned at the stake.
text: In Oxford, Archbishop of Canterbury Thomas Cranmer is burned at the stake.

title: A fire in New Orleans leaves most of the town in ruins.
text: A fire in New Orleans leaves most of the town in ruins.

title: With the church leadership driven out of Rome during an armed conflict, Pius VII is crowned Pope in Venice with a temporary papal tiara made of papier-mâché.
text: With the church leadership driven out of Rome during an armed conflict, Pius VII is crowned Pope in Venice with a temporary papal tiara made of papier-mâché.

title: The Battle of Alexandria is fought between British and French forces near the ruins of Nicopolis in Egypt.
text: The Battle of Alexandria is fought between British and French forces near the ruins of Nicopolis in Egypt.

title: Code Napoléon is adopted as French civil law.
text: Code Napoléon is adopted as French civil law.

title: Napoleonic Wars: Austrian forces repel French troops in the Battle of Arcis-sur-Aube.
text: Napoleonic Wars: Austrian forces repel French troops in the Battle of Arcis-sur-Aube.

title: The Bahá'í calendar begins. This is the first day of the first year of the Bahá'í calendar. It is annually celebrated by members of the Bahá'í Faith as the Bahá'í New Year or Náw-Rúz.
text: The Bahá'í calendar begins. This is the first day of the first year of the Bahá'í calendar. It is annually celebrated by members of the Bahá'í Faith as the Bahá'í New Year or Náw-Rúz.

title: Alexander Stephens gives the Cornerstone Speech.
text: Alexander Stephens gives the Cornerstone Speech.

title: Otto von Bismarck is appointed as the first Chancellor of the German Empire.
text: Otto von Bismarck is appointed as the first Chancellor of the German Empire.

title: Journalist Henry Morton Stanley begins his trek to find the missionary and explorer David Livingstone.
text: Journalist Henry Morton Stanley begins his trek to find the missionary and explorer David Livingstone.

title: Over 360 are killed and 20,000 homes destroyed in the Great Dayton Flood in Dayton, Ohio.
text: Over 360 are killed and 20,000 homes destroyed in the Great Dayton Flood in Dayton, Ohio.

title: World War I: The first phase of the German Spring Offensive, Operation Michael, begins.
text: World War I: The first phase of the German Spring Offensive, Operation Michael, begins.

title: The Hungarian Soviet Republic is established becoming the first Communist government to be formed in Europe after the October Revolution in Russia.
text: The Hungarian Soviet Republic is established becoming the first Communist government to be formed in Europe after the October Revolution in Russia.

title: The New Economic Policy is implemented by the Bolshevik Party in response to the economic failure as a result of war communism.
text: The New Economic Policy is implemented by the Bolshevik Party in response to the economic failure as a result of war communism.

title: The Butler Act prohibits the teaching of human evolution in Tennessee.
text: The Butler Act prohibits the teaching of human evolution in Tennessee.

title: Syngman Rhee is removed from office after being impeached as the President of the Provisional Government of the Republic of Korea.
text: Syngman Rhee is removed from office after being impeached as the President of the Provisional Government of the Republic of Korea.

title: Charles Lindbergh is presented with the Medal of Honor for the first solo trans-Atlantic flight.
text: Charles Lindbergh is presented with the Medal of Honor for the first solo trans-Atlantic flight.

title: Shah of Iran Reza Shah Pahlavi formally asks the international community to call Persia by its native name, Iran.
text: Shah of Iran Reza Shah Pahlavi formally asks the international community to call Persia by its native name, Iran.

title: Ponce massacre: Nineteen people in Ponce, Puerto Rico are gunned down by police acting on orders of the US-appointed Governor, Blanton C. Winship.
text: Ponce massacre: Nineteen people in Ponce, Puerto Rico are gunned down by police acting on orders of the US-appointed Governor, Blanton C. Winship.

title: Wehrmacht officer Rudolf von Gersdorff plots to assassinate Adolf Hitler by using a suicide bomb, but the plan falls through; von Gersdorff is able to defuse the bomb in time and avoid suspicion.
text: Wehrmacht officer Rudolf von Gersdorff plots to assassinate Adolf Hitler by using a suicide bomb, but the plan falls through; von Gersdorff is able to defuse the bomb in time and avoid suspicion.

title: World War II: British troops liberate Mandalay, Burma.
text: World War II: British troops liberate Mandalay, Burma.

title: World War II: Operation Carthage: Royal Air Force planes bomb Gestapo headquarters in Copenhagen, Denmark. They also accidentally hit a school, killing 125 civilians.
text: World War II: Operation Carthage: Royal Air Force planes bomb Gestapo headquarters in Copenhagen, Denmark. They also accidentally hit a school, killing 125 civilians.

title: World War II: Bulgaria and the Soviet Union successfully complete their defense of the north bank of the Drava River as the Battle of the Transdanubian Hills concludes.
text: World War II: Bulgaria and the Soviet Union successfully complete their defense of the north bank of the Drava River as the Battle of the Transdanubian Hills concludes.

title: The Los Angeles Rams sign Kenny Washington, making him the first African American player in the American football since 1933.
text: The Los Angeles Rams sign Kenny Washington, making him the first African American player in the American football since 1933.

title: Alan Freed presents the Moondog Coronation Ball, the first rock and roll concert, in Cleveland, Ohio.
text: Alan Freed presents the Moondog Coronation Ball, the first rock and roll concert, in Cleveland, Ohio.

title: Apartheid: Sharpeville massacre, South Africa: Police open fire on a group of black South African demonstrators, killing 69 and wounding 180.
text: Apartheid: Sharpeville massacre, South Africa: Police open fire on a group of black South African demonstrators, killing 69 and wounding 180.

title: Alcatraz Federal Penitentiary (in California) closes.
text: Alcatraz Federal Penitentiary (in California) closes.

title: Ranger program: NASA launches Ranger 9, the last in a series of unmanned lunar space probes.
text: Ranger program: NASA launches Ranger 9, the last in a series of unmanned lunar space probes.

title: Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. leads 3,200 people on the start of the third and finally successful civil rights march from Selma to Montgomery, Alabama.
text: Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. leads 3,200 people on the start of the third and finally successful civil rights march from Selma to Montgomery, Alabama.

title: Battle of Karameh in Jordan between the Israel Defense Forces and the combined forces of the Jordanian Armed Forces and PLO.
text: Battle of Karameh in Jordan between the Israel Defense Forces and the combined forces of the Jordanian Armed Forces and PLO.

title: The first Earth Day proclamation is issued by Joseph Alioto, Mayor of San Francisco.
text: The first Earth Day proclamation is issued by Joseph Alioto, Mayor of San Francisco.

title: U.S. President Jimmy Carter announces a United States boycott of the 1980 Summer Olympics in Moscow to protest the Soviet–Afghan War.
text: U.S. President Jimmy Carter announces a United States boycott of the 1980 Summer Olympics in Moscow to protest the Soviet–Afghan War.

title: The first cases of the 1983 West Bank fainting epidemic begin; Israelis and Palestinians accuse each other of poison gas, but the cause is later determined mostly to be psychosomatic.
text: The first cases of the 1983 West Bank fainting epidemic begin; Israelis and Palestinians accuse each other of poison gas, but the cause is later determined mostly to be psychosomatic.

title: Debi Thomas became the first African American to win the World Figure Skating Championships

title: Namibia becomes independent after 75 years of South African rule.

title: Bertrand Piccard and Brian Jones become the first to circumnavigate the Earth in a hot air balloon.
